results.title: Phase one: Prince Charles Mountains
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Roger Hayne
results.brief_description: Shows the work of a topographical and geological survey of the Prince Charles Mountains, Antarctica in 1969. Under summer conditions the land forms are visible, and valuable data is collected and evaluated.

results.title: Phase diagrams
results.brief_description: The construction and use of phase diagrams and why they are a critical part of understanding how igneous rocks form. Deals with the construction and use of phase diagrams. Demonstrates how a simple diagram can be built and extended to three component systems. Step by step a three-dimensional phase diagram using three binary eutectics is constructed. Shows how phase diagrams can contribute to our understanding of how igneous rocks form, and demonstrates both basalt and granite systems.

results.title: Pharmaceuticals
results.creator_credit: Robert Richter, Thirteen and WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Pesticides and pills for export only”.
The film presents evidence that products banned or restricted in developed countries because of the danger to humans or the environment are exported to the Third World by multinational corporations. This episode investigates the trade in toxic pharmaceuticals.

results.title: Phantom of the paradise [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Edward Pressman, Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Harbour productions and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Director Brian De Palma offer’s up a colourful variation on The Phantom of the Opera in this outrageous Faustian parody of the 70’s rock scene. Paul Williams stars (and also acts as the films composer) as Swan an outlandish record producer who after hearing the latest composition from struggling composer Winslow Leach (William Finley), conspires to steal the piece for the opening of his latest nightclub, the Paradise. Leach catches on to Swans dastardly plan and breaks into Swans Death Records studio in order to destroy the pirated copies of his work. Unfortunately a horrible accident with the vinyl press leaves Leach grossly disfigured, thus transforming him into the Phantom of the Paradise. This masked spook then decides to exact his own brand of revenge, determined to ruin Swans latest glam rock show. Intitialy ignored and misunderstood on it’s first release, Phantom of the Paradise went on to aquire a loyal cult following, who laped up the skewered mix of horror, glam rock and music industry parody. Cast includes: Jessica Harper, George Memmoli, Gerritt Graham.

results.title: Phalaris staggers. Part 2: the acute stages
results.brief_description: Hyper excitability is invariably the symptom of the Phalaris Staggers in the acute phase. Generalised muscular tremors, rapid bobbing of the head, and lack of coordination in gait are also characteristic. This record of these outward symptoms was filmed at an experimental area at Brecon, in South Australia, between July and August, 1953.

results.title: Phalaris staggers. [Part 1: chronic phalaris staggers]
results.brief_description: Sheep grazing freshly shooting “Phalaris tuberosa” particularly following the break of dry season, often develop neurological disorders commonly known a “Phalaris Staggers”. The outward manifestations of the disease have been recorded in two films intended for veterinary officers. A complete lack of muscular coordination is obvious in all chronically affected sheep observed during an outbreak of the disease in the southeast of South Australia, in October 1951. Knees and fetlocks either remain flexed or tend to buckle under, and sheep move about with a propping gait on their knees. Exertion or agitation leads to respiratory distress.

results.title: Phagocytes the body's defenders
results.brief_description: Photomicrography of the circulatory system and the processes of mitosis and phagocytosis. The film reveals how the body is protected from disease by the white blood corpuscles or leucocytes which engulf and destroy invading organisms.

results.title: Pewter
results.creator_credit: British Foundation Pictures and Ronald Haines
results.brief_description: A study of the pewter industry in Great Britain, showing where the industry grew up and why, how the processes are carried out, and why today the pewter industry has all but disappeared in Britain.
results.description: A study of the pewter industry in Great Britain, showing where the industry grew up and why, how the processes are carried out, and why today the pewter industry has all but disappeared in Britain.

results.title: Petunia (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios and Audio Visual Aids
results.brief_description: Petunia, the silly goose, is the self-appointed adviser to the barnyard animals. Masking her ignorance, she struts around with a book under her wing. However, when she interprets the word DANGER as “candies”, near tragedy results. Based on the book by Roger Duvoisin.
